Body: There are 11 baskets of peaches. Each basket has 10 red peaches and 18 green peaches.
Question: How many peaches are in the baskets altogether?

Body: Paul got a box of 440 crayons for his birthday. During the school year he gave 111 crayons to his friends while he lost 106 crayons.
Question: How many crayons did he have left?

Question: How many campers went rowing in the morning?

Question: How many sacks of oranges will they have after 51 days of harvest?

Question: How many more books than action figures were on his shelf?

Question: How many friends did he give crackers to?

Question: How many more games does Katie have than her friends?

Question: How many children are on the bus now?
